author: jgm
content: I don't see this as being a core function of Ethereum.  No reason why someone couldn't create an ERC-20 that awarded tokens for some sort of useful work and that could be swapped for ETH if desired, but I'd like to see us move past the "burn electricity for security" narrative.

author: sky.cactus
content: This wouldn't be for security at all.  It would be a social good.  A small tax on Ethereum holders (via inflation) in exchange for allowing people in restricted/censored situations to acquire ETH.

author: sky.cactus
content: You cannot just "create a token" for this, because that token would need to have value to be useful.

author: jgm
content: That would be the point of it doing some sort of useful work (folding, hunting primes, anything).  Make the work worth something.

author: sky.cactus
content: It is very non-trivial to come up with useful work that has the property that it is many orders of magnitude easier to verify the result than to calculate the result.

author: jgm
content: Sure, but the point would be to not make it part of the protocol.  Having a "work for tokens" model could be a simple "burn electricity for ETH" in the degenerate case easily enough, but would be bounded and allow for more interesting work.
